Description: Head from a terracotta female figure. A woman’s head, broken from a figure; her hair, with a centre parting, is brushed softly back to be covered by a sakkos, at the rear of which it emerges in a bun. Mould-made, with some hand-tooling; once applied to a separately made body. Micaceous Nile silt, varying from orangebrown to dark brown, and probably burnt; red paint on the bun.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Near: Leyenaar-Plaisier 1979: no. 1534, dated second half of third century bc; Fischer 1994: no. 158, dated third century bc.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (C408)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
